required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Value of Clinical and Biological Factors in Patients With Refractory/Relapsed Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Observational, Post-authorization, Cross-sectional Study to Evaluate the Prognostic Value of Clinical and Biological Factors in Patients With Refractory/Relapsed Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Grupo Español de Linfomas y Transplante Autólogo de Médula Ósea

clinical_study.source: Grupo Español de Linfomas y Transplante Autólogo de Médula Ósea

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the prognostic value of clinical and biological factors in patients with refractory/relapsed Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma.

detailed_description.textblock: The main aim of this study is to compare the prognostic value of R-IPI at diagnosis and relapse, relating it with the obtained response after second line

primary_outcome.description: Data will be recorded from diagnosis to second line response, an expected average of 7 months

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the 2nd line of treatment, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: The IPI is based on the evaluation of 5 clinical factors: age > 60 years Ann Arbor stage III or IV disease > 1 extra nodal site European Cooperative Oncology Group performance status (ECOG PS) _ 2, increased serum LDH (lactate dehydrogenase) levels Revised IPI (R-IPI) evaluates the same parameters, but groups them differently to form 3 prognostic groups of patients with significantly different progression-free survival and overall survival outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Predictive Value of R-IPI at Diagnosis

secondary_outcome.description: immunohistochemical reaction of cells with Bcl-2 antibody

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the 2nd line of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: immunohistochemical reaction of cells with Bcl-2 antibody
immunohistochemical reaction of cells with Bcl-6 antibody

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the second line of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: immunohistochemical reaction of cells with Bcl-6 antibody
immunohistochemical reaction of cells with p-53 antibody

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the 2nd line of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: immunohistochemical reaction of cells with p-53 antibody
immunohistochemical reaction of cells with MUM-1 antibody

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the 2nd line of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: immunohistochemical reaction of cells with MUM-1 antibody

secondary_outcome.measure: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG) Performance Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the 2nd line of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: ECOG=0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction ECOG=5: Exitus

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the 2nd line of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Ann Arbor=I: Best condition Ann Arbor=IV: Worst condition

secondary_outcome.measure: Response to First Line of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions for at least 8 weeks. Partial response (PR): At least a 50% dicrease in the sum of the products of two measurements (the maximum diameter of a tumor and the largest diameter perpendicular to this maximum diameter) of 6 biggest individual tumors. Not increased of measure of other tumors, spleen or liver Stable Disease (SD): Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started Progressive Disease (PD): At least a 50% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions during or at the end of the treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response to Second Line of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions for at least 8 weeks. Partial response (PR): At least a 50% dicrease in the sum of the products of two measurements (the maximum diameter of a tumor and the largest diameter perpendicular to this maximum diameter) of 6 biggest individual tumors. Not increased of measure of other tumors, spleen or liver Stable Disease (SD): Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started Progressive Disease (PD): At least a 50% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions during or at the end of the treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship Between Global Response Rate to 2nd (Second) Line of Treatment and Bcl-2 Expression at Diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Global response rate was assessed using the National Cancer Institute-sponsored Working Group guidelines. Responses are: complete response, partial response, stable disease, progression and relapse

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship Between Global Response Rate to 2nd Line of Treatment and Bcl-6 Expression at Diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Global response rate was assessed using the National Cancer Institute-sponsored Working Group guidelines. Responses are: complete response, partial response, stable disease, progression and relapse

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship Between Global Response Rate to 2nd Line of Treatment and p53 Expression at Diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Global response rate was assessed using the National Cancer Institute-sponsored Working Group guidelines. Responses are: complete response, partial response, stable disease, progression and relapse

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship Between Global Response Rate to 2nd Line of Treatment and Multiple Myeloma Oncogene 1 (MUM1) Expression at Diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Global response rate was assessed using the National Cancer Institute-sponsored Working Group guidelines. Responses are: complete response, partial response, stable disease, progression and relapse

arm_group.description: patients with refractory/relapsed diffuse large B-cell lymphoma

study_pop.textblock: Patients with refractory/relapsed diffuse large B-cell lymphoma

criteria.textblock:
- Age 18 > years old
- Patients with refractory/relapsed diffuse large B-cell lymphoma after first line treatment with rituximab, with or without transplantation. Patients must have finished a rescue treatment including rituximab
- Ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent

overall_official.affiliation: Grupo Español de Linfomas/Trasplante Autólogo de Médula Ósea

facility.name: H. U. Germans Trias i Pujol
Hospital General del SAS de Jerez
H. Clínico U. Santiago de Compostela

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment was carried out between April 2009 and January 2011 in Hematology Departments of 56 Spanish Hospitals

class.title: Global response to 2nd line + very good prognos

outcome.title: Relationship Between Global Response Rate to 2nd (Second) Line of Treatment and Bcl-2 Expression at Diagnosis
outcome.description: Global response rate was assessed using the National Cancer Institute-sponsored Working Group guidelines. Responses are: complete response, partial response, stable disease, progression and relapse

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
